member.remarks: This method returns a set of options for a given scope. Options defined in this scope will not affect options in its ancestor scopes. member.typeparam: The type of tag returned by the aggregator.
member.remarks: The default tag aggregator implementation also does the following: for each over which it aggregates tags, if the tagger is , call Dispose() on it when the aggregator is disposed or when the taggers are dropped. For example, you should call Dispose() when the content type of a text buffer changes or when a buffer is removed from the buffer graph.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Tagging.ITagAggregator`1.GetTags(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.SnapshotSpan)
member.summary: Gets all the tags that overlap or are contained by the specified of the same type as the aggregator.
member.returns: All the tags that overlap the region.

remarks.para: The default tag aggregator lazily enumerates the tags of its objects. Because of this, the ordering of the returned mapping spans cannot be predicted. If you need an ordered set of spans, you should collect the returned tag spans, after being mapped to the buffer of interest, into a sortable collection.

member.name: E:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Tagging.ITagAggregator`1.BatchedTagsChanged
member.summary: Occurs on idle after one or more TagsChanged events.

remarks.para: This is a batched version of the TagsChanged event. One or more TagsChanged events are accumulated and then raised as a single BatchedTagsChanged event on idle using the that was active when the ITagAggregator was created.
This event is less noisy than TagsChanged and is always raised on the thread that was active when the ITagAggregator was created.

member.summary: Determines whether one is compatible with another.
member.returns: true if the merge should proceed, otherwise false.
member.remarks: Merging happens only when merge policies in primitives are compatible. This function should be symmetric and ideally constant time. For instance, (this.GetType() == other.GetType()).

member.returns: true of the merge should proceed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.IMergeTextUndoTransactionPolicy.PerformTransactionMerge(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoTransaction,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoTransaction)
member.summary: Merges a new with an existing one.
member.remarks: Merges newTransaction into existingTransaction by adding, removing, or modifying the primitives in existingTransaction.UndoPrimitives. A simple implementation could be to add each primitive in newTransaction.UndoPrimitives to existingTransaction.UndoPrimitives.

member.summary: Contains undo transactions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.CreateTransaction(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new transaction, nests it in the previously current transaction, and marks it current.
member.returns: The new transaction.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.Undo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the specified number of undo operations and places the transactions on the redo stack.
member.param: The number of undo operations to perform.
member.remarks: At the end of the operation, the specified number of visible transactions are undone. Therefore, the actual number of transactions undone might be more than this number if there are hidden transactions above or below the visible ones. After the last visible transaction is undone, the hidden transactions left on top the stack are undone as well, until a visible or linked transaction is encountered, or the stack is completely emptied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.Redo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the specified number of redo operation and places the transactions on the undo stack.
member.param: The number of redo operations to perform. At the end of the operation, the specified number of visible transactions are redone. Therefore, the actual number of transactions redone might be more than this number, if there are hidden transactions above or below the visible ones.
member.remarks: After the last visible transaction is redone, the hidden transactions left on top the stack are redone as well, until a visible or linked transaction is encountered, or the stack is completely emptied.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.UndoStack
member.summary: The undo stack for this history. It does not include any currently open or redo transactions.
member.remarks: This stack includes the most recent transaction (the top item of the stack) to the oldest transaction (the bottom item of the stack).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.RedoStack
member.summary: The redo stack for this history. It does not include any currently open or undo transactions.
member.remarks: This stack includes the most recent transaction (the top item of the stack) to the oldest transaction (the bottom item of the stack).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.LastUndoTransaction
member.summary: Gets the most recent (top) item of the , or null if the stack is empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.LastRedoTransaction
member.summary: Gets the most recent (top) item of the , or null if the stack is empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.ITextUndoHistory.CanRedo

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState
member.summary: Holds the state of the transaction.
member.remarks: There are five rough groups of transactions. Open transactions are being defined. Canceled transactions have been aborted and are empty. Completed and undone transactions have been defined and are ready for undo and redo, respectively. Undoing and redoing are transient states as the transaction passes between completed and undone. Invalid is a state for transactions that have expired.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Open
member.summary: Represents the initial state of the transaction, after it has been created and before it is canceled or completed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Completed
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction is no longer being defined, and is eligible for undo.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Canceled
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction is no longer being defined, but has been aborted and cleared.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Redoing
member.summary: Indicates a transient state set by Do(), between the undone state and the completed state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Undoing
member.summary: Indicates a transient state set by Undo(), between the completed state and the Undone state.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Undone
member.summary: Indicates that Undo() was called after completion.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Text.Operations.UndoTransactionState.Invalid
member.summary: Indicates that the transaction has been removed the undo history stack, for example because it was on the redo stack when a new operation cleared the redo stack. Once a transaction is invalid it should not be used for anything.
